isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - INSTALL - REAR WINDOW GLASS ON Daycab VEHICLES

svcproc.title: REAR WINDOW GLASS ON Daycab VEHICLES

svcsubproc.title: Install Rear Window Glass on Daycab Vehicles

important.para: To install rear window glass you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has a tool box that includes the tools required to remove and install bonded rear window glass. To order, call toll free in U. S. and Canada 1-800-520-2584 or Fax 1-800-578-7375. NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.

svcsubproc.para: To install rear window glass, you will also need the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 104) . The kit includes:

item.para: U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

svcsubproc.para: These materials must be used on or before expiration date marked on container. U413 Fence Primer, U401 Glass Prep and U402 Glass Primer have a 6 month shelf life. U216 Urethane adhesive A and Curative B tubes have a 9 month shelf life.
In addition to the items supplied in the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 104) , you will need the following materials:

item.para: Applicator nozzles supplied by Essex® to puncture U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

note.para: Use only heat treated glass (AS-2 per ANSI Z26.1-Latest revision).

warning.para: Wear protective work gloves when handling the rear window glass. Also wear appropriate protective gloves when using any of the Betaseal system chemicals from the Essex® windshield installation kit.

note.para: Before installing new rear window glass, wipe off any water remaining around rear window fence and surrounding cab area with a lint free cloth.

step1.para: Dry fit new rear window glass on vehicle to make sure the glass fits rear window opening properly before applying U216 adhesive. Once the rear window glass is positioned properly in the rear window opening, place a piece of tape as a reference mark across the top and bottom center portion of rear window glass and cab. Use a utility knife and cut the tape between the cab and rear window glass.
Remove new rear window glass from vehicle and place it on a suitable padded work stand to prepare it for installation.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 125 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove urethane adhesive (Item 1) from rear window fence (Item 2) around window opening with a gasket chisel (Item 3). A thin layer of old urethane adhesive of 2 to 3 mm thick (Item 4) may be left on window fence. Try to keep a consistent thickness of old urethane adhesive around the perimeter of the window fence.

figure.caption: Figure 125. Removing Urethane Adhesive from Rear Window Fence

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. OLD URETHANE ADHESIVE (2 TO 3 MM THICK ALLOWED)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 126 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Clean dirt and any water left from spraying around rear window glass during removal, off rear window fence (Item 1) with a brush or clean, lint free cloth (Item 2) before installing new rear window glass.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 107
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Take U413 window fence primer from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 1, Figure 104) . Shake U413 window fence primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 127 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U413 window fence primer (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to cover scratches and bare metal on rear window fence (Item 3). DO NOT apply U413 window fence primer over old urethane adhesive left on rear window fence.

figure.caption: Figure 127. Applying Window Fence Primer to Rear Window Glass Fence

step1.para: Allow U413 window fence primer to dry for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.
With new rear window glass on a padded work stand, prepare rear window glass for installation as follows:

Using a razor blade if necessary, and plastic scrubbing pad, remove any encapsulation flash from bonding surface of new rear window glass. Clean new rear window glass thoroughly with Essex® glass cleaner GC800. Dry thoroughly with paper towels. Make sure rear window glass is completely clean and dry before proceeding (Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Cleaning Rear Window Glass for Glass Prep, Glass Primer and Adhesive Application

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 107
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once the new rear window glass has been cleaned, take U401 window glass prep from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 2, Figure 104) . Shake U401 window glass prep (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

note.para: Read completely through Step 11 below to ensure the correct application and removal of the window glass prep U401.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U401 window glass prep (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface only on new rear window glass (Item 3). If applied to clear glass surface, glass will haze. Immediately wipe glass prep off by following eight to ten inches behind the applicator with a white or brown paper towel (Item 4). DO NOT use a cloth shop towel. After completing first application of glass prep, repeat glass prep application and removal process. This is a clear liquid.

figure.caption: Figure 129. Application of Glass Prep to Rear Window Glass

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 107
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once U401 window glass prep has been applied and wiped off new rear window glass, take U402 window glass primer from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 3, Figure 104) . Shake U402 window glass primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 130 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U402 window glass primer (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface on new rear window glass (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 130. Application of Window Glass Primer to Rear Window Glass

step1.para: Allow U402 window glass primer to dry to a tack free condition for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.

caution.para: Once the rear window glass has been primed, ensure there is no contact with bonding surface as oil from skin will affect bonding performance. If the rear window glass is not bonded properly, the cab strength and safety would be compromised. If contact with bonding surface has occurred, repeat the cleaning process and reapply U402 window glass primer and allow it to dry for 6 to 10 minutes before applying U216 adhesive.

step1.para: Remove Essex® U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B) from Essex® windshield installation kit (Items 4 and 5, Figure 104) .

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using the pull tab or a screwdriver (Item 1), if pull tab not supplied, pry out bottom cover (Item 2) from both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Removing Bottom Cover from Adhesive Tubes

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Use one applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture adhesive A tube (Item 2). Use the other applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture curative B tube (Item 2). DO NOT use the same applicator nozzle to puncture both tubes; this keeps from contaminating the other tube before installing application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 104) . Be sure to push applicator nozzle all the way in to ensure adhesive tubes are fully opened.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ADHESIVE A TUBE OR CURATIVE B TUBE

step1.para:
Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 2) have been prepared for use, remove application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 104)
from Essex® windshield installation kit.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 133 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) on mixing head (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 133. Installing both Adhesive Tubes to Mixing Head

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ADHESIVE A AND CURATIVE B ADHESIVE TUBES

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 134 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) are installed on mixing head (Item 2), remove applicator nozzle (Item 7, Figure 104)
from Essex® windshield installation kit. Install applicator nozzle (Item 3) on mixing head (Item 2). Cut tab (Item 4) off applicator nozzle.

figure.caption: Figure 134. Installing Applicator Nozzle on Mixing Head and Cutting Tab Off

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ADHESIVE A AND CURATIVE B ADHESIVE TUBES

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 135 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before loading adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) into betagun (Item 2), pull trigger and run plungers (Item 3) all the way back to allow for adhesive tubes to be loaded. Open front cover (Item 4) on betagun and install adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle into betagun.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ADHESIVE TUBES WITH MIXING HEAD AND APPLICATOR NOZZLE

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 136 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) have been installed into betagun (Item 2), close front cover (Item 3). Run plungers (Item 4) forward on betagun until plungers are in position to apply adhesive. Stop when adhesive reaches applicator nozzle.

figure.caption: Figure 136. Running Plungers Forward on Betagun

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ADHESIVE TUBES WITH MIXING HEAD AND APPLICATOR NOZZLE

note.para: Application of adhesive bead on new rear window glass shall be 0 to 2 mm from encapsulation edge and be at least 5/8 to 3/4 inch (15 to 20 mm) high and 3/8 to 1/2 inch (8 to 12 mm) wide maximum.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Hold betagun (Item 1) and applicator nozzle (Item 2) as close to a 90 degree angle as possible and start at the center of the bottom edge of rear window glass. Going across the bottom in either direction, pull trigger to apply a uniform bead of adhesive (Item 3) all the way around rear window glass. The harder you pull the trigger the faster the adhesive will extrude. Use this variable speed control to slow down as you apply adhesive around the corners. Overlap adhesive at the seam slightly, and use a plastic or wood tongue depressor (Item 4) to smooth or even out adhesive as required before installing rear window glass.

figure.caption: Figure 137. Using Betagun to Apply Adhesive

step1.para: Once adhesive has been applied on rear window glass it MUST be installed within 5 to 7 minutes maximum. Adhesive starts curing immediately and will not provide an adequate bond if not installed within the 5 to 7 minute time frame.
With the aid of an assistant install rear window glass as follows:

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 138 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Align tape marks (Item 1) on top and bottom of rear window glass (Item 2) with tape marks (Item 3) on top and bottom of window opening of cab (Item 4), also position lower window glass locator tabs (Item 5) between window locators (Item 6) of lower window fence of cab. Make sure upper window glass spring clip (Item 7) is inside top of window fence (Item 8).
With the aid of an assistant, gently push on rear window glass all around outer edge to set it properly against window fence.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 139 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the rear window glass (Item 1) is set properly against the window fence, using tape (Item 2) tape rear window glass to the back of the cab (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 139. Taping Rear Window Glass in Place

step1.para:
Remove pieces of tape (Items 1 and 3, Figure 138)
from top and bottom of rear window glass and cab rear window opening that was used during installation rear window glass.

If removed during rear window glass removal, install the seats back into the cab. Refer to
SEATS
. For installing passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Air Bucket Seat on Daycab. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Daycab. For installing driver bucket seat , refer to Install Driver Air Bucket Seat on Daycab.

caution.para: Be careful while putting the seats back into the cab, not to hit the rear window glass while the adhesive is curing. This may cause rear window glass to not seal properly and could cause leaking.

important.para:
The quick curing time of U216 two part urethane adhesive allows the vehicle to be driven 30 minutes after completing rear window glass installation. You will need to use the area on the Form Bonded Windshield Replacement Report (Figure 151)
to record Time, Temperature and Humidity.
